title: Verifying contracts on optimsm doesn't work on Optimism
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [ ] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (6130af7 2022-04-06T00:04:11.858449+00:00)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

 forge verify-contract

### Operating System

macOS (M1)

### Describe the bug

Trying to verify an optimism contract with:

forge verify-contract --chain-id 69 --num-of-optimizations 1000000 --constructor-args < abi-encoded-args > --compiler-version v0.8.13+commit.abaa5c0e < contract-address > < path:contract > < etherscan-key >

does not work. When verifying the verification I get the message below which is not very telling. Not sure what could be wrong, followed the docs very closely. 

Error: 
   0: Contract verification failed:
      Response: `NOTOK`
      Details: `Fail - Unable to verify`
You're passing an empty `--constructor-args` flag so it thinks your constructor arg is `--compiler-version`
if there are no constructor args you can remove `--constructor-args`

sorry guys my bad, didnt want to paste the whole abi encoded args in. But yeah they come after the args flag like this

forge verify-contract --chain-id 69 --num-of-optimizations 1000000 --constructor-args < abi-encoded-args > --compiler-version v0.8.13+commit.abaa5c0e < contract-address > < path:contract > < etherscan-key >
Does `--num-of-optimizations` match what you deployed the contract with using `forge create`?
I deployed it with forge default settings. Do you know how I can check this? I thought this is the default optimization value
The default is 200, see [here](https://book.getfoundry.sh/reference/forge/forge-build.html#the-optimizer)
thanks did that still same behaviour. though i might be using the wrong solc version. I am using the one that I found in the cache folder under artifacts. Is that right?

I'm not entirely sure what you mean - if you run `forge build` it should show you the version used. Then, run `~/.svm/x.y.z/solc-x.y.z --version` (replacing x.y.z with the version number) to get the full version. Finally, look up the actual version on https://etherscan.io/solcversions

It's a bit of an adventure, unfortunately, but we hope to make this a lot easier over time

in the cache folder that gets generated through forge build there is a file called solidity-files-cache in which i found what i think is the compiler version that was used (see screenshot below) The way you recommended yields the same result. So I guess i am using the right compiler version 0.8.13+commit.abaa5c0e Not sure why the verification isen't working. Should I provide something to reproduce?

Do you add the `v` in front of the compiler version?

Otherwise yes, something to reproduce would be helpful :smile:
yeah yeah i did :) will send something over to reproduce! Thanks

I was able to verify the contract:

```
forge create --rpc-url $ETH_RPC_URL --private-key $PRIVATE_KEY src/ERC721CryptoTesters.sol:ERC721CryptoTesters --constructor-args "test" "test" 0x320d00a7b006cf53ef07d9d44030a767bd2703919199d3373c726f5322a3d7d8 0 0
```

```
forge verify-contract --chain-id 69 --num-of-optimizations 200 --compiler-version v0.8.13+commit.abaa5c0e --constructor-args (cast abi-encode "constructor(string,string,bytes32,bool,bool)" "test" "test" 0x320d00a7b006cf53ef07d9d44030a767bd2703919199d3373c726f5322a3d7d8 0 0) 0x3a3bf482cb19c65e2606d22fa3e8f2b56d248f1c src/ERC721CryptoTesters.sol:ERC721CryptoTester $ETHERSCAN_API_KEY
```

doesn't work for me.. are you sure you verified it? Cause the contract i see in your command is not verified @onbjerg  (https://kovan-optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x3a3bf482cb19c65e2606d22fa3e8f2b56d248f1c)
Ah, maybe I forgot to run `verify-check`.
will debug this on optimism!

I am unable to verify on rinkeby too.

```
forge create --rpc-url <alchemy rinkeby url> --private-key <private key> src/Cally.sol:Cally
```

```
forge verify-contract --chain-id 4 --num-of-optimizations 200 --compiler-version v0.8.13+commit.abaa5c0e  <address>  src/Cally.flattened.sol:Cally <etherscan key>
```

```
forge verify-check --chain-id 4 <guid> <etherscan key>
```

output:

```
Error: 
   0: Contract verification failed:
      Response: `NOTOK`
      Details: `Fail - Unable to verify`
```

(there are no constructor args in my contract either)

foundry.toml file:

```toml
[default]
solc_version = "0.8.13"
fuzz_runs = 1000
optimizer_runs = 200
optimizer = true
```

> src/Cally.flattened.sol

I assume this was flattened first? does this file compile successfully on its own?
Yes it compiles. In either case using Cally.flattened.sol or Cally.sol, both fail the verification though.

ah, after updating to the latest version with `foundryup` I can see it works on rinkeby now. I was using a version from early April. sorry for cluttering the thread.

```
forge 0.2.0 (721093d 2022-04-05T00:07:09.103400+00:00)
```

by verifying manually you mean trough etherscan ui? i managed to verify with hardhat as well as long as i deploy with hardhat. For some reason when i deploy with forge the verification won't work with hardhat for that contract.. unfortunately i have no idea how to debug this
thanks for checking, I'll have a look at both requests

> by verifying manually you mean through etherscan ui? I managed to verify with hardhat as well as long as I deploy with hardhat. For some reason when I deploy with forge the verification won't work with hardhat for that contract.. unfortunately, i have no idea how to debug this

still have no idea, why this is failing in the command, the API is also not helpful.
any chance you could dump the working request object that hardhat is sending?

doesn't make much sense why it works manually but the same content fails when send as request...

fixed a lot of verify bugs since 
therefore and because op verify tests pass in CI, closing this optimistically
